faqs.question: Can foreigners buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Yes, foreigners can freely purchase property in Spain without residency restrictions. Non-EU citizens may require an NIE (Spanish Tax Identification Number), but this is straightforward to obtain. Many international buyers successfully purchase Costa Blanca properties annually. Our team can guide you through all legal and administrative requirements.

faqs.question: What are the costs of buying property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Beyond the purchase price, typical costs include transfer tax (6-10%), legal fees (€600-1,500), notary fees (0.5-1%), and property registration fees. Mortgage arrangements typically require 20-30% down payment. At SOL NATURA's competitive pricing, total acquisition costs remain significantly below comparable European markets.

faqs.question: Do I need a visa to buy property in Spain?
faqs.answer: Property purchase alone doesn't require a visa, but you'll need documentation to complete the transaction. If planning extended residence, you may explore various Spanish visa options including the Digital Nomad Visa or Non-lucrative Visa. Our advisors can discuss residency options during your purchase consultation.

faqs.question: How much are property taxes in Spain?
faqs.answer: Annual property taxes (IBI) typically range from 0.4% to 1.1% of registered property value. Inheritance taxes apply only when property passes to heirs. These rates remain competitive compared to other European countries, and SOL NATURA's reasonable property valuations keep annual tax obligations modest.
